intro: Carex pringlei, commonly known as Pringle's sedge, is a flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to the Pacific Northwest of North America, particularly found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and is often found in association with other moisture-loving plants. Carex pringlei plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
